content:
Penn State pitcher Jenn Reynolds  earned the win in the Lions  victory over St PERIOD Francis yesterday PERIOD

Advertisement

Penn State catcher Hollee Haines ended last nights doubleheader the same way she started it  with a home run PERIOD

Haines smacked a threerun homer in her first at bat and finished with a gamewinning solo shot in her last trip to the plate PERIOD The effort helped produce a  win and a  victory over St PERIOD Francis Pa. during last nights doubleheader PERIOD

It was the closest the Red Flash had come to a win in  years and  meetings PERIOD

St PERIOD Francis coach Erin Layton hesitated and paused for a good  seconds when asked if she was surprised by the close game PERIOD

 Layton said smiling PERIOD 

On both long balls Haines extended her arms to make solid contact with two outside curveballs PERIOD Both went screaming over the left field wall PERIOD

 Penn State coach Robin Petrini said PERIOD See ya Whoopeethank youThe pitchers were happyPeople were cold too so they wanted to get out of there.Obviously today we werent driving in runs like we usually doBut everybody has ups and downs PERIOD



Petrini also praised the Red Flash  complimenting Layton on her somewhatunorthodox strategy of putting her ace in the circle for the second game PERIOD The pitcher Laura Caldwell finished with seven Ks and only one earned run Haines homer PERIOD The Lions first run came off an error on the third basemen PERIOD

With the two wins Penn State  continues its best start in program history PERIOD The Lions have never recorded  wins before April PERIOD

 Haines said PERIOD
